newsitem.title: CANADA: Sears Canada plans C$100 mln share issue.
newsitem.headline: Sears Canada plans C$100 mln share issue.

text.p: Sears Canada Inc said on Monday that it is issuing 9.5 million common shares at C$10.50 per share for total gross proceeds of C$100 million before expenses.
The shares were sold on a bought deal basis to an underwriting syndicate led by CIBC Wood Gundy Securities Inc, the Canadian department store retailer said in a statement.
Sears said it has granted an option to purchase up to 952,381 additional common shares for additional gross proceeds of C$10 million before expenses.
The issue is scheduled to close on December 9, 1996.
Proceeds of the issue will initially be used to repay debt and, therefore, provide future financial capacity to support the roll out of the company's strategic initiatives.

Sears, Roebuck and Co owns 61.1% of the common shares of Sears Canada. Sears Roebuck will retain its majority position with an ownership of about 55% of Sears Canada after the transaction closes. Sears Roebuck has indicated that it will not be participating in the offering given its significant capital expenditure programme underway in the United States, Sears Canada said.
